sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
Consider the matrix A, where
A = $\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 4 & 6 & 8 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 3 & 6 & 9 & 12 \\ \end{pmatrix}$

Determine the rank of matrix A using elementary row operations.
message_2:
To determine the rank of matrix A using elementary row operations, we will perform Gaussian elimination to transform the matrix into its row echelon form.

Matrix A:
$\begin{pmatrix}
2 & 4 & 6 & 8 \\
1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\
3 & 6 & 9 & 12 \\
\end{pmatrix}$

Step 1: Swap row 1 and row 2 to have a 1 in the top left corner.
$\begin{pmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\
2 & 4 & 6 & 8 \\
3 & 6 & 9 & 12 \\
\end{pmatrix}$

Step 2: Subtract 2 times row 1 from row 2, and subtract 3 times row 1 from row 3.
$\begin{pmatrix}
1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\
0 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
\end{pmatrix}$

Now, the matrix is in row echelon form. The rank of a matrix is the number of non-zero rows in its row echelon form. In this case, there is only 1 non-zero row, so the rank of matrix A is 1.
